file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-52-03-02 - INBOARD FLAP TRAILING EDGE - REPLACEMENT - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL INBOARD FLAP TRAILING EDGE - REPLACEMENT - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to replace the trailing edge and install a new one, when the damage extension is out of repairable limits. B. These procedures are applicable to the inboard flap trailing edge of the LH and RH wings. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY INBOARD FLAP TRAILING EDGE - RE- ALL 57-52-03-960-801-A PLACEMENT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-52-03 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-52-03-960-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. INBOARD FLAP TRAILING EDGE - REPLACEMENT A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to replace the trailing edge and install a new one, when the damage extension is out of repairable limits. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-801-A/400 INBOARD FLAP - REMOVAL AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-801-A/400 INBOARD FLAP - INSTALLATION CPM 51-21-04 - SRM 51-40-02 PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 532 - LH wing 632 - RH wing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone (MEK) AR Commercially available Aluminum-oxide abrasive sandpaper No. 200 AR Aluminum-oxide abrasive sandpaper No. 400, 500 and Commercially available AR 600 MEP 09-066 Adhesive, Epoxy, Type II AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Inboard Flap Trailing Edge EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 57-52-03 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Replacement of the Inboard Flap Trailing Edge (Figure 201) (Figure 202) (Figure 203) SUBTASK 960-002-A (1) Remove the inboard flap (AMM TASK 27-50-00-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove and discard the damaged trailing edge, by removing the required attachement fasteners. (3) Bonding strip installation. (a) Position the bonding strip in the trailing edge P/N 145-68041-005 at root area where there is a room to install it, and make it flush with the trailing edge. Refer to Figure 202, Sheet 3. (b) Install bonding strip with MS14218AD4-4 fasteners and shave the formed head. (c) Apply alodine 1200 (CPM 51-21-04). (4) Positioning of the trailing edge to torque box. (a) Align edges of torque-box and trailing edge at flap-root. (b) In the manufacturing jig (or alternative, equivalent tooling) position the flap and the trailing assuring system line. (c) Mark in the trailing edge the position of the existing holes in the torque box, root fitting, tip fitting and central fitting. (d) Make sure that all edge distances are kept to 2.5D at least. (e) Install the trailing edge using fastener mapping and SRM 51-40-02 PR practices keeping a typical gap of 5 mm max and a typical step of 0.8mm max between the trailing edge and the torque box in the upper side and between the trailing edge and the leading edge in the lower side. Refer to Figure 202, Sheets 1 to 3 and to Figure 203, Sheets 1 to 3. (5) Final assembly: CAUTION: THIS ASSEMBLY AFFECTS INTERCHANGEABILITY OF ROOT AND TIP FAIRINGS. (a) Once the trailing edge is installed proceed with the root and tip ribs and the nut plates located at root and tip. (b) Use the manufacturing jig (or alternative, equivalent tooling) to position both ribs and drill holes in the ribs and in the trailing edge where nut plates have to be installed. (c) Make sure that all edge distances are kept to 2.5D at least. Install using fastener mapping and SRM 51-40-02 PR practices. (d) Install the inboard flap ( AMM TASK 27-50-00-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 960-801-A/200 57-52-03 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
